doc:
Elisha Cook Jr. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elisha_Cook_Jr. 0 Elisha Vanslyck Cook Jr. (December 26, 1903 – May 18, 1995) was an American stage, film and television character actor who often specialized in roles as "cowardly villains and neurotics." He is perhaps best remembered for his portrayal of Wilmer in the 1941 version of The Maltese Falcon and the futile efforts made by his character to intimidate Sam Spade (Humphrey Bogart) in the film. Cook's acting career spanned more than 60 years, with roles in productions such as The Big Sleep, Shane, The Killing, House on Haunted Hill, and Rosemary's Baby. Elisha_Vanslyck_Cook_Jr. ( December_26_,_1903 – May_18_,_1995 ) was an_American_stage , film_and_television_character_actor who often specialized in roles as "_cowardly_villains_and_neurotics . " He is_perhaps_best_remembered for his_portrayal of Wilmer in the_1941_version of The_Maltese_Falcon and the_futile_efforts made by his_character to_intimidate Sam_Spade_(_Humphrey_Bogart_) in the_film . Cook 's_acting_career spanned more_than_60_years , with roles in productions such_as The_Big_Sleep , Shane , The_Killing_,_House on Haunted_Hill , and Rosemary 's_Baby .
